title.narrative: International Dialogue on Migration 2019 - Youth and Migration: Engaging Youth as Key Partner in Migration Governance

description.narrative: In 2019 the International Dialogue on Migration will focus on youth and migration in response to the calls at the IDM in 2018 for greater engagement with and involvement of youth in migration governance efforts, as well as UN Member States’ demand for more coherent and comprehensive approach by the UN System to youth development. Its objective will be in line with the United Nations Youth Strategy, especially priority 1: Engagement, Participation and Advocacy. Two separate IDM sessions will be convened, one in New York and the other inGeneva, bringing around the discussion table youth representatives and all relevant migration stakeholders. The outcome of the discussions willconsist of lessons learned and experiences that governments and other partners can employ in designing policies to manage youth migration. Thedialogue will be in line with ongoing global processes and support UN’s overall efforts to amplify youth voices and promote their involvement inglobal migration debates. It will also inform national migration and youth strategies and promote the contribution youth can make to migration governance. It will contribute to collective efforts on enhancing migration governance, and policy frameworks and fostering greater cooperation and partnerships, and networks for future action.

policy-marker.narrative: Project with some but insufficient inclusion of gender issues
